content.text: is designed to handle the processing of account cancellations that span multiple billing periods within the

database. It performs several operations, including moving data into a temporary table, parsing account cancellation information, updating gas rate codes, merging summary data into an adjustment table, and inserting new records into an adjustment table. The procedure also includes logic for updating and deleting records based on certain conditions.
The complexity of this stored procedure is high due to the following reasons:
It involves multiple data manipulation operations, including
It calls another stored procedure and several user-defined functions.
It performs complex calculations and conditional logic.
It involves multiple joins and subqueries, which can be computationally intensive.
The procedure handles a significant amount of business logic, making it intricate and challenging to maintain.
: Represents the billing period in the format
: An identifier for the authenticated user executing the procedure.
: Represents the billing cycle, a single character indicating a specific cycle.
The procedure begins by inserting data from
is greater than 1. This involves calculating therm factors and billing period days using user-defined functions.
to further process the spanned account cancellation information.
The procedure sets a default gas rate code and updates it based on a join with the
table to reflect the commodity tariff rate.
table by merging data from a summarized subquery of
for cancellations not already present in the table, using aggregated data from
The procedure updates records to unite rebills with existing cancels and deletes cancels that had rebills. It also updates cancels that had no rebills.
: The use of multiple joins and subqueries can lead to performance bottlenecks, especially if the tables involved are large.
: Frequent calls to user-defined functions can be costly in terms of performance, particularly if these functions are not optimized.
: The procedure processes large datasets, which can impact execution time and resource usage.
: Proper indexing on the tables involved, especially on columns used in joins and where clauses, can significantly improve performance.
: The procedure involves multiple updates and inserts, which can lead to locking and blocking issues in a high-concurrency environment.
: The logic for merging and deleting records must be carefully managed to prevent data loss or corruption.
: The procedure lacks explicit error handling, which could lead to unhandled exceptions and incomplete transactions.
: As data volume grows, the complexity and resource demands of the procedure may lead to scalability issues.
: The high complexity and extensive business logic make the procedure difficult to maintain and modify without introducing errors.

-- =============================================
-- Author:		<Author,,Name>
-- Create date: <Create Date,,>
-- Description:	<Description,,>
-- =============================================
CREATE PROCEDURE [NationalGridWest].[usp_LegacyData_ProcessAccountCancellationSpanned] 
	@BillingPeriod varchar(6),
	@authenticatedID int,
	@BillingCycle varchar(1)
AS
BEGIN

/**************************
1. Move data into the upload spanned table
***************************/
	INSERT INTO [NationalGridWest].UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationTempSummarySpanned
	(title, 
	AccountNumber,	
	MeterNumber, 
	BillingPeriod, 
	BillingPeriodRevision, 
	FirstPeriodCanceled, 
	CancelFromDate, 
	CancelToDate, 
	CancelBilledAmount, 
    CancelTherms, 
	CancelThermFactor, 
	CancelCCF, 
	CancelTariffCode, 
	CancelBillingPeriodDays, 
	FacilityName, 
	ServiceAddress, 
	DeltaNumberOfPeriods, 
    Dials, 
	PostingDate)
	SELECT  
		'SpannedCancellation' AS title,   
		AccountNumber, 
		MeterNumber AS MeterNumber, 
		BillingPeriod, 
		BillingPeriodRevision,  
		FirstPeriodCanceled as FirstPeriodCanceled, 
		FromDate as CancelFromDate, 
		ToDate as CancelToDate, 
		BilledAmount as CancelBilledAmount, 
        Therms as CancelTherms, 
		[dbo].[CalculateGasThermFactor] 
		(CCF,Therms) as CancelThermFactor, 
		CCF as CancelCCF, 
		TariffCode as CancelTariffCode, 
		DATEDIFF(day, [dbo].[ConvertYYYYMMDDToDatetime] (FromDate),[dbo].[ConvertYYYYMMDDToDatetime] (ToDate)) as CancelBillingPeriodDays, 
		FacilityName as FacilityName, 
        ServiceAddress as ServiceAddress, 
		DeltaNumberOfPeriods AS DeltaNumberOfPeriods, 
		Dials AS Dials,PostingDate
	FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellation
	WHERE (DeltaNumberOfPeriods > 1)

/*******************************
2. Parse spanned billed upload account cancellation info
*********************************/
 exec NationalGridWest.usp_LegacyData_ParseSpannedAccountCancellationInfo @BillingPeriod, @authenticatedID, @BillingCycle


/*******************************
3. Set gas rate code
*********************************/
-- set default gas rate code
UPDATE NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary
SET GasRateCode = '020'

-- set gas rate code = commodity tariff rate in EC3
UPDATE  s
SET s.GasRateCode = a.CommodityTariffRate 
FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary AS s, Billing.Account AS a
WHERE s.OriginalAccountNumber = a.OriginalAccountNumber

/*******************************
4. Merge summary data into adjustment
*********************************/

UPDATE  UploadAdjustmentGas
SET     UploadAdjustmentGas.[NumberOfTransactions] = UploadAdjustmentGas.[NumberOfTransactions] + CancelSummary.[NumberOfTransactions],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[NumberOfCancelTransactions] = CancelSummary.[NumberOfTransactions],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[TotalCanceledAmount] = CancelSummary.[TotalCanceledAmount],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelFromDate] = CancelSummary.[CancelFromDate],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelToDate] = CancelSummary.[CancelToDate],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelTotalCCF] = CancelSummary.[CancelTotalCCF],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelTotalTherms] = CancelSummary.[CancelTotalTherms],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelThermsFactor] = CancelSummary.[CancelThermsFactor],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[CancelBillingDays] = CancelSummary.[CancelBillingDays],
        UploadAdjustmentGas.[Notes] 
			= CAST(( CASE UploadAdjustmentGas.[Notes]
                                               WHEN NULL THEN ''
                                               ELSE 'Rebill: '
                                                    + UploadAdjustmentGas.[Notes]
                                                    + ' '
                                             END )
					+ ( CASE CancelSummary.[Notes]
					  WHEN NULL THEN ''
					  ELSE 'Cancel: ' + CancelSummary.[Notes]
					END ) AS VARCHAR(300))
FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas AS UploadAdjustmentGas
        INNER JOIN ( 
					SELECT UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.OriginalAccountNumber,
                           UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.BillingPeriodRevision,
                           COUNT(*) AS NumberOfTransactions,        -- ,[NumberOfTransactions] 
                           0 AS NumberOfRebilledTransactions, -- ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]             
                           COUNT(*) AS NumberOfCancelTransactions, -- ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
                           SUM(TotalCanceledAmount) AS TotalCanceledAmount,
                           MIN(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelFromDate) AS CancelFromDate,     --               ,<CancelFromDate, yyyymmdd,>
                           MAX(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelToDate) AS CancelToDate,     --               ,<CancelToDate, yyyymmdd,>
                            SUM(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelTotalCCF) AS CancelTotalCCF,     --               ,<CancelTotalCCF, EnergyUnit,>
                            SUM(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelTotalTherms) CancelTotalTherms,     --               ,<CancelTotalTherms, EnergyUnit,>
                            MIN(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelThermsFactor) CancelThermsFactor,     --               ,<CancelThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
                            dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(MIN(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelFromDate),
                                                             MAX(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.CancelToDate)) AS CancelBillingDays,   --               ,<CancelBillingDays, int,>
                            MAX(UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.Notes) AS notes
                     FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary
                     GROUP BY UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.OriginalAccountNumber,
                            UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.BillingPeriodRevision
                   ) AS CancelSummary ON UploadAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = CancelSummary.OriginalAccountNumber
                                         AND UploadAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = cancelSummary.BillingPeriodRevision



/* =========================== */

INSERT INTO NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas
	([AdjustedAccount]
	   ,[AccountUtilityCompanySeqid]
	   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
	   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
	   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
	   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
	   ,[BillingPeriod]
	   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
	   ,[FirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
	   ,[EstimatedOrActualBilling]
	   ,[InitialCancelFromDate]
	   ,[CurrentBillingToDate]
	   ,[NumberOfBillingPeriods]
	   ,[TotalBillingDaysRebilled]
	   ,[TotalRebilledAmount]
	   ,[TotalCanceledAmount]
	   ,[AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge]
	   ,[AverageRebillThermsFactor]
	   ,[BillingDays]
	   ,[BillingDate]
	   ,[ToDate]
	   ,[FromDate]
	   ,[BillingAction]
	   ,[ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod]
	   ,[GasRateCode]
	   ,[TotalCCF]
	   ,[TotalTherms]
	   ,[ThermsFactor]
	   ,[CancelFromDate]
	   ,[CancelToDate]
	   ,[CancelTotalCCF]			
	   ,[CancelTotalTherms]			
	   ,[CancelThermsFactor]			
	   ,[CancelBillingDays]	
	   ,[ProcessEffectiveDate]
	   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
	   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
	   ,[SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
	   ,[SpannedBilledAmount]
	   ,[SpannedCCF]
	   ,[SpannedThermFactor]
	   ,[SpannedTherm]
	   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
	   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]			
	   ,[Notes]			
	   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]			
	   ,[DateAdded]			
	   ,[LastUpdate]			
	   ,[FacilityName]
	   ,[ServiceAddress]
	   )	

	SELECT 			
		NULL	,	--	           (<AdjustedAccount, seqid,>
		2	,	--	           ,<AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, seqid,>
		count(*)	,	   -- ,[NumberOfTransactions]	
		0 , -- [NumberOfRebillTransactions]			
		count(*), -- [NumberOfCancelTransactions]	
		OriginalAccountNumber,	-- <OriginalAccountNumber, acctnum,>
		MAX(BillingPeriod),	-- <BillingPeriod, BillingPeriod,>	
		BillingPeriodRevision,	-- <BillingPeriodRevision, BillingPeriodRevision,>
		NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelFromDate), 'F', substring(max(OriginalAccountNumber),12,2)) as 'FirstCanceledBillingPeriod', --<FirstCancelPeriod, yyyymm,>
		'ACT' as 'EstimatedOrActualBilling',
		MIN(InitialCancelFromDate)	,	--	           ,<InitialCancelFromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MAX(CurrentBillingToDate)	,	--	           ,<CurrentBillingToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		[dbo].[CalculateDeltaBillingPeriods]
		(
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelFromDate), 'F', substring(OriginalAccountNumber,12,2)),
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelToDate), 'T', substring(OriginalAccountNumber,12,2)),
			@BillingCycle                                                      
		) as 'NumberOfBillingPeriods',
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(MIN(CancelFromDate),MAX(CancelToDate))	,	--	           ,<TotalBillingDaysRebilled, int,>
		SUM(TotalRebilledAmount)	,	--	           ,<TotalRebilledAmount, money,>
		SUM(TotalCanceledAmount)	,	--	           ,<TotalCanceledAmount, money,>
		AVG(CostOfGasCharge)	,	--	           ,<AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge, money,>
		AVG(ThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<AverageRebillThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		0	,	--	           ,<BillingDays, int,>
		MAX(BillingDate)	,	--	           ,<BillingDate, int,>
		MAX(ToDate)	,	--	           ,<ToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MIN(FromDate)	,	--	           ,<FromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		CASE WHEN MAX(BillingPeriod)=MIN(BillingPeriodRevision) THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END	,	--	          ,<BillingAction, BillingAction,>
		'N'	,	--	  !!!         ,<ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, yesno,>
		MAX(GasRateCode)	,	--	           ,<GasRateCode, varchar(3),>
		SUM(TotalCCF)	,	--	           ,<TotalCCF, EnergyUnit,>
		SUM(TotalTherms)	,	--	           ,<TotalTherms, EnergyUnit,>
		min(ThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<ThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		MIN(CancelFromDate)	,	--	           ,<CancelFromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MAX(CancelToDate)	,	--	           ,<CancelToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		SUM(CancelTotalCCF)	,	--	           ,<CancelTotalCCF, EnergyUnit,>
		SUM(CancelTotalTherms)	,	--	           ,<CancelTotalTherms, EnergyUnit,>
		MIN(CancelThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<CancelThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(MIN(CancelFromDate),MAX(CancelToDate))	,	--	           ,<CancelBillingDays, int,>
		[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()),	--	           ,<ProcessEffectiveDate, varchar(8),>
		MAX(DerivedFromSpannedBill),
		MAX(SpannedBillingPeriodRevision),
		MAX(SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod),
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedBilledAmount)>0 then max(SpannedBilledAmount)
		else min(SpannedBilledAmount) end AS SpannedBilledAmount,
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedCCF)>0 then max(SpannedCCF)
		else min(SpannedCCF) end AS SpannedCCF,
		MAX(SpannedThermFactor),
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedTherm)>0 then max(SpannedTherm)
		else min(SpannedTherm) end AS SpannedTherm,
		min(SpannedMonthlyPercentage),
		min(SpannedTotalPercentage) ,
		MAX(Notes),			
		MAX(AuthenticatedUserID),			
		GETDATE(),			
		GETDATE(),			
		max(FacilityName),
		max(ServiceAddress)
		FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary
		WHERE UploadLegacyKeyspanCancellationSummarySeqid
		NOT IN
		(
			  SELECT UploadLegacyKeyspanCancellationSummarySeqid
			  FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary AS cancelSum
			  INNER JOIN NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas AS adj
			  ON cancelSum.BillingPeriodRevision = adj.BillingPeriodRevision 
			  AND cancelSum.OriginalAccountNumber = adj.OriginalAccountNumber
		)
		GROUP BY UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.OriginalAccountNumber, UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary.BillingPeriodRevision

/*
INSERT INTO NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas
	([AdjustedAccount]
	   ,[AccountUtilityCompanySeqid]
	   ,[NumberOfTransactions]
	   ,[NumberOfRebillTransactions]
	   ,[NumberOfCancelTransactions]
	   ,[OriginalAccountNumber]
	   ,[BillingPeriod]
	   ,[BillingPeriodRevision]
	   ,[FirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
	   ,[EstimatedOrActualBilling]
	   ,[InitialCancelFromDate]
	   ,[CurrentBillingToDate]
	   ,[NumberOfBillingPeriods]
	   ,[TotalBillingDaysRebilled]
	   ,[TotalRebilledAmount]
	   ,[TotalCanceledAmount]
	   ,[AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge]
	   ,[AverageRebillThermsFactor]
	   ,[BillingDays]
	   ,[BillingDate]
	   ,[ToDate]
	   ,[FromDate]
	   ,[BillingAction]
	   ,[ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod]
	   ,[GasRateCode]
	   ,[TotalCCF]
	   ,[TotalTherms]
	   ,[ThermsFactor]
	   ,[CancelFromDate]
	   ,[CancelToDate]
	   ,[CancelTotalCCF]			
	   ,[CancelTotalTherms]			
	   ,[CancelThermsFactor]			
	   ,[CancelBillingDays]	
	   ,[ProcessEffectiveDate]
	   ,[DerivedFromSpannedBill]
	   ,[SpannedBillingPeriodRevision]
	   ,[SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod]
	   ,[SpannedBilledAmount]
	   ,[SpannedCCF]
	   ,[SpannedThermFactor]
	   ,[SpannedTherm]
	   ,[SpannedMonthlyPercentage]
	   ,[SpannedTotalPercentage]			
	   ,[Notes]			
	   ,[AuthenticatedUserID]			
	   ,[DateAdded]			
	   ,[LastUpdate]			
	   ,[FacilityName]
	   ,[ServiceAddress]
	   )	

	SELECT 			
		NULL	,	--	           (<AdjustedAccount, seqid,>
		2	,	--	           ,<AccountUtilityCompanySeqid, seqid,>
		count(*)	,	   -- ,[NumberOfTransactions]	
		0 , -- [NumberOfRebillTransactions]			
		count(*), -- [NumberOfCancelTransactions]	
		OriginalAccountNumber,	-- <OriginalAccountNumber, acctnum,>
		MAX(BillingPeriod),	-- <BillingPeriod, BillingPeriod,>	
		BillingPeriodRevision,	-- <BillingPeriodRevision, BillingPeriodRevision,>
		NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelFromDate), 'F', substring(max(OriginalAccountNumber),12,2)) as 'FirstCanceledBillingPeriod', --<FirstCancelPeriod, yyyymm,>
		'ACT' as 'EstimatedOrActualBilling',
		MIN(InitialCancelFromDate)	,	--	           ,<InitialCancelFromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MAX(CurrentBillingToDate)	,	--	           ,<CurrentBillingToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		[dbo].[CalculateDeltaBillingPeriods]
		(
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelFromDate), 'F', substring(OriginalAccountNumber,12,2)),
			NationalGridWest.DetermineBillingPeriod(@BillingCycle, Min(CancelToDate), 'T', substring(OriginalAccountNumber,12,2)),
			@BillingCycle                                                      
		) as 'NumberOfBillingPeriods',
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(MIN(CancelFromDate),MAX(CancelToDate))	,	--	           ,<TotalBillingDaysRebilled, int,>
		SUM(TotalRebilledAmount)	,	--	           ,<TotalRebilledAmount, money,>
		SUM(TotalCanceledAmount)	,	--	           ,<TotalCanceledAmount, money,>
		AVG(CostOfGasCharge)	,	--	           ,<AverageRebillCostOfGasCharge, money,>
		AVG(ThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<AverageRebillThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		0	,	--	           ,<BillingDays, int,>
		MAX(BillingDate)	,	--	           ,<BillingDate, int,>
		MAX(ToDate)	,	--	           ,<ToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MIN(FromDate)	,	--	           ,<FromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		CASE WHEN MAX(BillingPeriod)=MIN(BillingPeriodRevision) THEN 'O' ELSE 'A' END	,	--	          ,<BillingAction, BillingAction,>
		'N'	,	--	  !!!         ,<ProcessedInTheCurrentPeriod, yesno,>
		MAX(GasRateCode)	,	--	           ,<GasRateCode, varchar(3),>
		SUM(TotalCCF)	,	--	           ,<TotalCCF, EnergyUnit,>
		SUM(TotalTherms)	,	--	           ,<TotalTherms, EnergyUnit,>
		min(ThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<ThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		MIN(CancelFromDate)	,	--	           ,<CancelFromDate, yyyymmdd,>
		MAX(CancelToDate)	,	--	           ,<CancelToDate, yyyymmdd,>
		SUM(CancelTotalCCF)	,	--	           ,<CancelTotalCCF, EnergyUnit,>
		SUM(CancelTotalTherms)	,	--	           ,<CancelTotalTherms, EnergyUnit,>
		MIN(CancelThermsFactor)	,	--	           ,<CancelThermsFactor, ThermsFactor,>
		dbo.CalculateNumberOfBillingDays(MIN(CancelFromDate),MAX(CancelToDate))	,	--	           ,<CancelBillingDays, int,>
		[dbo].ConvertDateToYYYYMMDD (GETDATE()),	--	           ,<ProcessEffectiveDate, varchar(8),>
		MAX(DerivedFromSpannedBill),
		MAX(SpannedBillingPeriodRevision),
		MAX(SpannedFirstCanceledBillingPeriod),
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedBilledAmount)>0 then max(SpannedBilledAmount)
		else min(SpannedBilledAmount) end AS SpannedBilledAmount,
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedCCF)>0 then max(SpannedCCF)
		else min(SpannedCCF) end AS SpannedCCF,
		MAX(SpannedThermFactor),
		CASE WHEN MAX(SpannedTherm)>0 then max(SpannedTherm)
		else min(SpannedTherm) end AS SpannedTherm,
		min(SpannedMonthlyPercentage),
		min(SpannedTotalPercentage) ,
		MAX(Notes),			
		MAX(AuthenticatedUserID),			
		GETDATE(),			
		GETDATE(),			
		max(FacilityName),
		max(ServiceAddress)
		FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestCancellationSummary	
		GROUP BY OriginalAccountNumber, BillingPeriodRevision	



------------ Now when Rebills and Cancels are in UploadConEdisonAccountBillingAdjustmentGas table------------------

--- Uniting Rebills with existing Cancels (Temporarily here)

update a1 -- NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas  
	set 
	[NumberOfTransactions]=a1.[NumberOfTransactions]+a2.[NumberOfTransactions],
	[NumberOfCancelTransactions]=a2.[NumberOfTransactions],
	[TotalCanceledAmount]=a2.[TotalCanceledAmount],
	[CancelFromDate]=a2.[CancelFromDate],
	[CancelToDate]=a2.[CancelToDate],
	[CancelTotalCCF]=a2.[CancelTotalCCF],
	[CancelTotalTherms]=a2.[CancelTotalTherms],
	[CancelThermsFactor]=a2.[CancelThermsFactor],
	[CancelBillingDays]=a2.[CancelBillingDays],
	[Notes]=CAST((CASE a2.[Notes] WHEN null THEN '' ELSE 'Rebill: '+a2.[Notes]+' ' END) + (CASE a2.[Notes] WHEN null THEN '' ELSE 'Cancel: '+a2.[Notes] END) AS varchar(300))
	
from 
   NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas as a1
	INNER JOIN
   NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas AS a2
	ON 
	a1.OriginalAccountNumber = a2.OriginalAccountNumber 
	AND
	a1.BillingPeriodRevision = a2.BillingPeriodRevision
WHERE (a1.NumberOfRebillTransactions > 0) AND 
      (a2.NumberOfCancelTransactions > 0)


--- Deleting Cancels that had Rebills
DELETE FROM 
NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas
FROM NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas INNER JOIN
NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas AS a1 
ON 
UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas.OriginalAccountNumber = a1.OriginalAccountNumber AND
UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas.BillingPeriodRevision = a1.BillingPeriodRevision AND
UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid <> a1.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGasSeqid
WHERE (UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas.NumberOfCancelTransactions > 0) AND 
  (a1.NumberOfCancelTransactions > 0 AND a1.NumberOfRebillTransactions > 0)


--- Update Cancels that had no Rebills
UPDATE NationalGridWest.UploadLegacyKeyspanWestAccountBillingAdjustmentGas 
SET
    [FromDate]=[CancelFromDate]
   ,[ToDate]=[CancelToDate]
WHERE  (NumberOfCancelTransactions > 0) AND (NumberOfRebillTransactions = 0)


*/
END
